DATA.TEXT: Oy, squiddie boy, ya seem like a bright lad! Take a butcher's 'ook 'ere.
Um... why did you get a briefcase full of weird numbers?
Oy, catch a clue, these numbers are keys, and they're worth more than a grand, innit Mickey?
Oy, that's right! And we're disposed to fence it to ya for a cracking price, tell'em Mack.
You've got a good instinct, brother.
Uh, I don't know what that is... and I don't really want to buy anything.
Listen, yer still a lad so I won't bludgeon ya, but this is the seed o' the revolution of art on the cosmo-net.
Right right, the price o' this will fly sky high, you're getting rich!
Ock ock!
But, but... I don't want to get rich.
Don't be daft, everyone wants to get rich. Are ya a skirt?
If yer rich, ya can buy whateva ya want!
Lad, I bet my own missus that ya fancy a mountain o' toys, innit? Make all ya friends gobsmacked with envy.
Um, it's just that... I don't want it, I can't even play with so many toys... I don't see why I would want that.
Why? WHY! Because having a lot is bloody all that ya got, innit Mickey?
Right, boss, I got four of those banana peelers, they're dirt cheap, innit Mack?
Yeah...
So ya see, lad, having a lot is all that ya got, the world is for those that got a whole lot.
I, I don't like this, you're all weird, I don't really want to talk to you anymore...
Hey, Mark, Mickey. We just lost everything to the woofers here. We're broke.
Whaaaat?
WHAAAAAAT?
Uh-uh! Eek, eek!
Oy, Monkey, calm down!
Uh, wait... His name is Monkey?.
What! Nah, that's just a monkey! Oy, get out o' here already, will ya?
Alright...
With Hugo at your side, your rocket-box departs from the planet, leaving the four monkeys to resume their game of cards.
